meanings.definition: To inhale smoke from a cigarette, pipe, or joint.
meanings.sent1: She toked on the joint at the party.
meanings.sent2: He always toked on his pipe while reading.
meanings.sent3: The cat accidentally toked on the candle smoke, sneezing comically.
meanings.sent4: The city seemed to have toked in the fog, its skyline obscured.
meanings.sent5: The old man's wrinkled face showed years of toking on cigars.

meanings.sent1: Yesterday, she toked on the cigarette behind the shed.
meanings.sent2: He had toked on the joint before the concert.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel quickly toked on the nut and scurried away.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood toked in her mind, vivid and nostalgic.
meanings.sent5: The campfire toked up into the night sky, a beacon of warmth.
